<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Oracular Crown](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2329)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Focused" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=74" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 151 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 1,200 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn headwear

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Patterns themed to your curse cover your _oracular crown_. As your curse worsens, the appearance of the crown changes, introducing extreme angles, stronger colors, or other indications of the intensity of your curse. Similarly, it gets closer to its natural form when you reduce the effects of your curse. You gain a +2 item bonus to [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) checks.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You gain 1 Focus Point, which you can use only to cast an oracle revelation spell. If not used by the end of your turn, this Focus Point is lost.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) **Frequency** once per day;  **Requirements** Your [cursebound](/Traits.aspx?ID=800) value is 1 or higher; **Effect** You regain 3d8 Hit Points. The amount of healing increases to 5d8 if you’re cursebound 2, 7d8 if you’re cursebound 3, or 9d8 if you’re cursebound 4. If you have the [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83) ability, this activation has the [void](/Traits.aspx?ID=510) trait instead of the healing and vitality traits.

**Craft Requirements** You are an [oracle](/Classes.aspx?ID=14).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
